title: Goldman Sachs CFO Stephen Scherr to Retire; Leveraged-finance banker Denis Coleman to succeed Scherr, who will leave at the end of the year
text:
"Denis has consistently proven himself through his strong judgment and operational capability across roles of increasing responsibility," Goldman Chief Executive David Solomon said in a statement.

Mr. Scherr joined Goldman in 1993 and, like Mr. Coleman, worked as an investment banker, helping companies raise money. He helped launch the firm's consumer bank, Marcus, and oversaw the development of its still nascent commercial-banking venture.

Write to Liz Hoffman at liz.hoffman@wsj.com

Goldman Sachs CFO Stephen Scherr to Retire
